intro: Aulonemia deflexa, commonly known as the flexible spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and dense clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often recurved, giving it a distinctive appearance. Aulonemia deflexa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
